I had to look up the weight of an elephant ... it depends on which sort, but basically they weigh between 2000kgs and 6500kgs.
"an elephant or a car' ... a car is another vague measurement, but most cars weigh somewhere between 1100kgs and 1900kgs.
The visual demonstration showed the jelly being run over by a car, ... let's say that car weighed 1600kgs, then you have just the one tyre squashing the example, so 1600 kgs divided by a 4 = 400kgs. But if you allow that the car is front engined and front wheel drive, the weight of that one tyre might have been more like 450kgs.
Given the size of the tyre contact area, the pressure is the same as a 100kg person standing on one foot, squashing that jelly.
